title: Attestation missed because beaconchain did not process a specific slot at all
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description My validator just missed attestation on slot 3871699. It is connected to my own beaconchain. Checking the logs for the beaconchain identifies, that there is no slot 3871699 in the log, but also no error. Somehow, the beaconchain completely ignored the slot 3871699. How can this happen? ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Never seen this one before, or maybe I did not check it. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction No Idea ## üî• Error 

[2022-05-23 07:39:11]  INFO blockchain: Finished applying state transition attestations=108 slot=3871694 syncBitsCount=501
[2022-05-23 07:39:23]  INFO blockchain: Synced new block block=0xa8b4edd5... epoch=120990 finalizedEpoch=120988 finalizedRoot=0x58a7b84d... parentRoot=0xcc2bfe77... slot=3871695 slotInEpoch=15 version=altair
[2022-05-23 07:39:23]  INFO blockchain: Finished applying state transition attestations=65 slot=3871695 syncBitsCount=501

[2022-05-23 07:40:08]  INFO p2p: Peer summary activePeers=53 inbound=46 outbound=7
[2022-05-23 07:40:24]  INFO blockchain: Synced new block block=0x7f0e3229... epoch=120990 finalizedEpoch=120988 finalizedRoot=0x58a7b84d... parentRoot=0x9e17be79... slot=3871700 slotInEpoch=20 version=altair
[2022-05-23 07:40:24]  INFO blockchain: Finished applying state transition attestations=128 slot=3871700 syncBitsCount=502

## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
2.12
**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**

Could you please attach validator logs as well? There may not be an error in the beacon node while there may be an error in the validator client. 

There was no block produced at 3871699 so that is why you do not see a log for that block. https://beaconcha.in/block/3871699
Thank you for the info, then it is not my validator and not a software bug. :)
